Quotes: If you call a tail a leg, how many legs has a dog? Five? No, calling a tail a leg don't make it a leg.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Methods of thought which claim to give the lead to our world in the name of revolution have become, in reality, ideologies of consent and not of rebellion.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: The distinction between the past, present and future is only a stubbornly persistent illusion.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: What makes the desert beautiful is that somewhere it hides a well.
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

Quotes: Truly it is an evil to be full of faults;but it is a still greater evil to be full of them and to be unwilling to recognize them, since that is to add the further fault of a voluntary illusion.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: The civility which money will purchase, is rarely extended to those who have none.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: No one thinks of how much blood it costs.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quotes: In a republic, that paradise of debility, the politician is a petty tyrant who obeys the laws.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: It is easier to appear worthy of a position one does not hold, than of the office which one fills.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Nothing is impossible;there are ways that lead to everything, and if we had sufficient will we should always have sufficient means. It is often merely for an excuse that we say things are impossible.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: No, not rich. I am a poor man with money, which is not the same thing.
Author: Gabriel Jose Garcia Marquez

Quotes: We don't stop playing because we grow old;we grow old because we stop playing.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Socialism is the same as Communism, only better English.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Oceania was at war with Eurasia;therefore Oceania had always been at war with Eurasia.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: One morning I shot an elephant in my pajamas. How he got into my pajamas I'll never know.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: Mysteries are not necessarily miracles.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Reality leaves a lot to the imagination.
Author: John Lennon

Quotes: The only paradise is paradise lost.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: I am an old man and have known a great many troubles, but most of them never happened.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: When I was younger I could remember anything, whether it happened or not.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The true mystery of the world is the visible, not the invisible.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Advertisements contain the only truths to be relied on in a newspaper.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: Everything being a constant carnival, there is no carnival left.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: The video game culture was an important thing to keep alive in the film because we're in a new era right now. The idea that kids can play video games like Grand Theft Auto or any video game is amazing. The video games are one step before a whole other virtual universe.
Author: Vin Diesel
